Interface StreamingRadio


  • public interface StreamingRadio
    This abstract data type represents the backend for a streaming radio service. It stores the songs, stations, and users in the system, as well as the ratings that users assign to songs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addSong(User currentUser, Song currentSong)
      This methods adds a song to the streaming service system and returns a boolean value.
      boolean addToStation(User currentUser, Song currentSong, Station chosenStation)
      This methods adds a song to a specific user's chosen station and returns a boolean value.
      void clearRating(User currentUser, Song currentSong)
      Clears a user's rating on a song.
      int predictRating(User currentUser, Song currentSong)
      Predicts the rating a user will assign to a video that they have not yet rated, as an integer number of stars from 1 to 5.
      boolean rateSong(User currentUser, Song currentSong, int rating)
      This method rates a song in the service with a rating from 1 to 5 stars and returns a boolean value.
      boolean removeFromStation(User currentUser, Song currentSong, Station chosenStation)
      This method removes a song from a user's chosen station and returns a boolean value.
      boolean removeSong(User currentUser, Song currentSong)
      This method removes a Song from the user's system, assuming the song is already present in the system, and returns a boolean value.
      Song suggestSong(User currentUser)
      NOTE: this method does not necessarily suggest songs that have never been listened to before or rated by the user.

    • Method Detail

      • addSong

        boolean addSong(User currentUser,
                Song currentSong)
         throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This methods adds a song to the streaming service system and returns a boolean value. If any of the parameters below are null then the method throws a NullPointerException. The method returns true if none of the parameters are null and the song has been added to the system. However, the method does nothing and returns false if the song trying to be added is already in the system. This is since it will not re-add a song to the system that already is present in that system. If currentSong is not an actual song found in the radio system, then the method will throw an IllegalArgumentException. NOTE: this is a dynamic-capacity list of songs and so there should never be an issue with the system running out of space to add more songs.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - the specific User to whose system we must add a Song
        currentSong - the specific Song that will be added to this User's system
        Returns:
        True if song has been added, false if song was already in the system
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when at least one parameter is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when currentSong is not an actual song in our system

      • removeSong

        boolean removeSong(User currentUser,
                   Song currentSong)
            throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method removes a Song from the user's system, assuming the song is already present in the system, and returns a boolean value. If any of the parameters below are null then the method throws a NullPointerException. If currentSong is not an actual song in our database of all songs, the method will throw an IllegalArgumentException. The method returns true if it removes a song from the user's system. The method returns false when the currentSong is in our database of all songs but was never in the user's system and so cannot be removed.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - the specific User to whose system we must remove a Song
        currentSong - the specific Song that will be removed from this User's system
        Returns:
        True if song was removed, false if song wasn't in the user's system
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when at least one parameter is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when currentSong is not a song that is in our database of all songs

      • addToStation

        boolean addToStation(User currentUser,
                     Song currentSong,
                     Station chosenStation)
              throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.util.NoSuchElementException
        This methods adds a song to a specific user's chosen station and returns a boolean value. If any of the three parameters below are null then the method throws a NullPointerException. The method throws an IllegalArgumentException if currentSong is not one of the songs in our database. The method throws a NoSuchElementException if chosenStation is not one of the stations that our system has. The method returns true if none of the parameters are null, no Exception's are thrown, and it adds the song to the user's chosen station. However, the method does nothing and returns false if the song trying to be added is already in that specific user's station. This is since it will not re-add a song to the station that already is present in that station.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - the specific User to whose Station we must add a Song
        currentSong - the specific Song that will be added to this User's specified Station
        chosenStation - the specific Station to which the Song will be added for this User
        Returns:
        True if song has been added to user's specified station, false if song was already in the station for this user
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when at least one parameter is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when currentSong is not a song in the radio's database of all songs.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when chosenStation is not an actual station that this service supports.

      • removeFromStation

        boolean removeFromStation(User currentUser,
                          Song currentSong,
                          Station chosenStation)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.util.NoSuchElementException
        This method removes a song from a user's chosen station and returns a boolean value. If any of the three parameters below are null then the method throws a NullPointerException. The method throws an IllegalArgumentException if currentSong is not one of the songs found in our database. The method throws a NoSuchElementException if chosenStation is not one of the stations that our system has. The method returns true if it is able to remove the given song from a user's given station. The method will return false if the valid song was never added in the user's chosen station and so cannot be removed.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - the specific User to whose Station we must remove a Song
        currentSong - the specific Song that will be removed from this User's specified Station
        chosenStation - the specific Station from which we remove the Song for this User
        Returns:
        true if song is removed, false if song was never added in the first place to user's chosen station
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when at least one parameter is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when currentSong is not a song in the database of all songs for this service.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - when chosenStation is not a station that this service supports.

      • rateSong

        boolean rateSong(User currentUser,
                 Song currentSong,
                 int rating)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.NullPointerException,
                 java.util.NoSuchElementException
        This method rates a song in the service with a rating from 1 to 5 stars and returns a boolean value. The method will return true if the song is valid, the rating is between 1 and 5, and the song has has been rated. The method will return false if the song is valid, the rating is between 1 and 5, the song has been rated, but this new rating overwrites a previous rating of the song done by the current user. The method throws an IllegalArgumentException if currentSong is not a song found in our database of songs. The method throws a NoSuchElementException if the rating is a number that is not between 1 and 5, inclusive. The method throws a NullPointerException if either the currentSong, currentUser, or the rating are null.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - the specific User to whose Station we must add a Song
        currentSong - the specific Song that will be added to this User's specified Station
        rating - the rating, from 0 to 5, that a User assigns to a specific Song
        Returns:
        true if song has been rated, false if song has been rated but new rating overwrites an old rating made by that same user
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if variables passed in violate header, the passed in variables do not exist, the rating passed in is not between 0 and 5
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if rating is a number not between 1 and 5, inclusive.

      • clearRating

        void clearRating(User currentUser,
                 Song currentSong)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        Clears a user's rating on a song. If this user has rated this song and the rating has not already been cleared, then the rating is cleared and the state will appear as if the rating was never made. If there is no such rating on record (either because this user has not rated this song, or because the rating has already been cleared), then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - user whose rating should be cleared
        currentSong - song from which the user's rating should be cleared
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user does not currently have a rating on record for the song
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the user or the song is null

      • predictRating

        int predictRating(User currentUser,
                  Song currentSong)
           throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Predicts the rating a user will assign to a video that they have not yet rated, as an integer number of stars from 1 to 5. It will give a value of 0 to new users who have just started using the system and so the service doesn't know much about their music taste. The method throws NullPointerException if either the currentUser or currentSong passed in are null. The method throws an IllegalArgumentException if the song passed in does not exist in the database of songs that this service has.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - user who we must return a rating to for the song passed in
        currentSong - song whose rating we must predict and return to user
        Returns:
        int which is the rating the method predicts the user would give the passed in song
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either of the variables passed in to the method are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if song passed in is not in database of songs

      • suggestSong

        Song suggestSong(User currentUser)
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        NOTE: this method does not necessarily suggest songs that have never been listened to before or rated by the user. Suggests and returns a Song that the user would most likely enjoy. The method throws a NullPointerException if either of the parameters passed in are null. The method throws an IllegalArgumentException if the user is very new to the service and the method doesn't have enough information about the user and their musical taste to make an informed decision about a song the user would enjoy listening to.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - the user who the method must suggest a song for
        Returns:
        Song the musical piece that the user would most likely enjoy listening to given their taste.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter passed in is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if user is new to service and there is not enough information about their musical taste
